title: Embrace Harvest Magic: Lughnasadh to Mabon Traditions

subtasks: Gathering ingredients (flour, water, yeast)
Mixing ingredients to create dough
Kneading dough on a clean surface
Shaping dough into desired bread form
Painting bread with egg wash
Placing bread in an oven to bake
Cooling bread to allow it to set
Collecting ears of corn at the proper ripeness
Removing kernels from the cob
Straightening and arranging corn strands
Braiding corn strands to form the dolly
Adorning corn dolly with natural materials (leaves, etc.)
Displaying corn dolly as a symbol of grain spirit
Researching Mabon traditions and meanings
Identifying symbols associated with Mabon
Commemorating balance and thanksgiving through rituals
Sharing knowledge of Mabon with others (community gatherings)

tasks.task: Bread making as a ritual practice for Mabon. Subtasks all related to building the bread, from start to finish. MAINTASK: Crafting corn dollies for Mabon rituals, with steps for gathering materials, making the dolly, and displaying it.

subtasks: Gather ingredients (flour, water, yeast)
Mix ingredients to create dough
Knead dough on a clean surface
Shape dough into desired bread form
Paint bread with egg wash
Place bread in an oven to bake
Cool bread to allow it to set
Collect ears of corn at the proper ripeness
Remove kernels from the cob
Straighten and arrange corn strands
Braid corn strands to form the dolly
Adorn dolly with natural materials (leaves, etc.)
Display corn dolly as a symbol of grain spirit
Research Mabon traditions and meanings
Identify symbols associated with Mabon
Commemorate balance and thanksgiving through rituals
Share knowledge of Mabon with others (community gatherings)

tasks.task: _OBSERVING_MABON_, maybe include subtasks like socializing with other celebrants, but given that those aren't explicit in the transcript... unless the requirement is to base the tasks directly on the given transcript. The transcript states that "crafting corn dollies is another common practice", and many incorporate bread making. So I think the tasks under observing Mabon can be the rituals, which might involve making corn dolls and bread.
subtasks: Hence, the SUBTASKs under Observing Mabon would be those related to the rituals performed, which presumably include making and using both the bread and corn dolls. Therefore, the MAINTASK and SUBTASKs as I listed should suffice.
Gather ingredients (flour, water, yeast)
Mix ingredients to create dough
Knead dough on a clean surface
Shape dough into desired bread form
Paint bread with egg wash
Place bread in an oven to bake
Cool bread to allow it to set
Collect ears of corn at the proper ripeness
Remove kernels from the cob
Straighten and arrange corn strands
Braid corn strands to form the dolly
Adorn dolly with natural materials (leaves, etc.)
Display corn dolly as a symbol of grain spirit
